result.execSummary:
The defendant James Myron Leonard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

miscConds.notes: Eligible upon successful completion of probation.

Provide DNA sample.
Comply with conditions imposed by Agent.

supervisions.notes:
Same as Ct#1
Concurrent with: Ct#1

records.addlTxt: from Judge Boles to DOC's letter re: length of sentence. " Yes, please amend JOC" Judge
from Atty Thorie re: agrees with DOC conclusion that a six month minimum probationary period is required.

from S/W DOC  re: requesting clarification of the probationary term order for Ct#1 and Ct#2. 973.09(2)(a) provides that a maximum original term of probation for misdemeanors is "not less than 6 months nor more than one year". The court did not provide a stated time period for the probationary term and instead gave an indeterminate term.
